research_metadata.title: Structuring Digital Forensic Intelligence from Pig-Butchering Scams: LLM-Based TTP Profiling and Multimodal Consistency Checking
research_metadata.title_korean: Pig Butchering 사기 신고 데이터에서 LLM 기반 TTP 프로파일링 및 멀티모달 정합성 점검을 통한 디지털 포렌식 인텔리전스 구조화
research_metadata.target_journal: FSI: Digital Investigation (SCI) or SSCI Journal

research_method_1.name: 텍스트 분석 - Fraud-TTPs 자동 정형화
research_method_1.description: LLM에 고정된 속성 스키마(JSON Schema)와 Chain-of-Thought 프롬프트를 적용하여 피해자 신고 텍스트에서 핵심 수사정보를 추출

research_method_2.name: 멀티모달 분석 - 텍스트와 이미지 정합성 점검
research_method_2.description: VLM을 활용하여 도메인, UI 패턴, 수익률 등을 추출하고 진술 텍스트에서 추출된 속성과 비교하여 정합성 점수(0.0-1.0)를 산출
outputs: 2 new wallet addresses extracted from images

validation_framework.name: 인간 전문가 상호 일치도 검증
validation_framework.description: 무작위 추출표본(10%)에 대해 인간 전문가와의 상호 일치도 검증

chain_of_thought_logs.description: LLM reasoning documentation for each case

finding_1.title: Initial Contact Platform Distribution
finding_1.result: WhatsApp is the primary communication migration channel (40.2%), followed by dating apps (24.5%) for initial contact
finding_1.implication: Platform-specific awareness campaigns should prioritize WhatsApp and dating apps

finding_2.title: Proof-of-Concept Withdrawal Tactic
finding_2.result: 33.9% of cases involve allowing small withdrawals to build victim trust before blocking larger withdrawals
finding_2.implication: Successful small withdrawals should not be used as indicator of platform legitimacy

finding_3.title: Tax Demand as Primary Blocking Tactic
finding_3.result: 55.4% of withdrawal blocking involves fake tax demands with fabricated legal citations
finding_3.implication: Public education should emphasize that legitimate exchanges never require tax payment before withdrawal

finding_4.title: Blockchain Address Extraction Rate
finding_4.result: 22.3% of narratives contain actionable blockchain addresses for forensic investigation
finding_4.implication: LLM extraction can significantly accelerate blockchain forensic workflows

finding_5.title: Brand Impersonation Prevalence
finding_5.result: 17.9% of cases involve impersonation of legitimate financial entities (exchanges, regulators)
finding_5.implication: Coordination with impersonated entities can enhance takedown and victim notification

finding_6.title: Multimodal Consistency
finding_6.result: All 25 image cases showed high text-image consistency (avg score: 0.94)
finding_6.implication: No false report indicators detected; victim narratives appear reliable

limitations: Self-reported data may contain subjective errors
LLM hallucination risk requires human validation
future_work: Expand to other state/federal scam databases

ethical_considerations.data_privacy: All data is publicly available from DFPI; victim identities not disclosed
ethical_considerations.responsible_disclosure: Wallet addresses shared for law enforcement/forensic purposes only
ethical_considerations.research_ethics: Study focuses on fraud prevention and victim protection

citation_ready_statistics.for_abstract: Analysis of 273 pig butchering cases yielded 112 TTP profiles, 42 blockchain addresses, and identified $18M+ in tracked losses
citation_ready_statistics.for_methodology: LLM-based extraction achieved 22.3% wallet address extraction rate with 0.94 average multimodal consistency score across 25 image cases
citation_ready_statistics.for_results: Tax demands (55.4%) and deposit-to-withdraw schemes (28.6%) were the most prevalent withdrawal blocking tactics; WhatsApp migration occurred in 40.2% of cases
